problem_statement: A retail company has developed an Express backend API for managing their warehouse inventory. The API handles product tracking, stock level management, and inventory transactions such as restocking and fulfilling orders. The development team rushed to meet a deadline and the API is now in production, but they never wrote proper tests. Recent bugs in production have caused inventory discrepancies that cost the company significant money, and management has mandated comprehensive test coverage before any new features can be added. The QA team needs a complete test suite that validates all API endpoints, business logic, edge cases, and error handling. The tests must be thorough enough to catch regressions and serve as documentation for expected API behavior. Additionally, the team wants meta-tests that validate the test suite itself is properly structured and achieves adequate coverage.
PASS_TO_PASS: should return all products when products exist
should return empty array when no products exist
should return filtered products when category query parameter is provided
should return empty array when category filter matches no products
should return all products when category parameter is empty string
should return 201 with created product when all required fields are provided
should return product with default category when category is not provided
should return product with zero stock when stockLevel is not provided
should return product with price of zero when price is zero
should return 409 conflict error when SKU already exists
should return 400 with validation message when sku is missing
should return 400 with validation message when name is missing
should return 400 with validation message when price is missing
should return 400 when price is negative
should return 400 when price is not a number
should handle product creation with very long name
should handle product creation with decimal price
should return correct product when valid ID is provided
should return 404 when product ID does not exist
should return 400 when ID format is invalid (non-numeric)
should return 404 when ID is a float string parsed as integer
should return 404 when ID is zero
should return 404 when ID is negative
should return updated product when valid update data is provided
should allow partial updates when only some fields are provided
should update SKU when new SKU is unique
should update category when provided
should return 409 when updating to duplicate SKU
should return 404 when updating non-existent product
should return 400 when updating price to negative value
should return 400 when updating price to non-number
should allow updating price to zero
should allow updating SKU to same value
should return 204 when product is successfully deleted
should make deleted product no longer retrievable
should remove deleted product from product list
should return 404 when deleting non-existent product
should return 404 when deleting already deleted product
should increase stock level correctly when valid quantity is provided
should handle multiple restocks correctly
should handle restock with decimal quantity
should return 400 when quantity is zero
should return 400 when quantity is negative
should return 404 when restocking non-existent product
should return 400 when quantity is not a number
should return 400 when quantity is missing
should handle very large restock quantities
should decrease stock level correctly when valid quantity is provided
should include updated stock level in response
should allow fulfilling entire stock
should return 400 with insufficient stock message when fulfilling more than available
should return 404 when fulfilling non-existent product
should fail when fulfilling from zero stock
should return products below default threshold of 10
should respect custom threshold query parameter
should return empty array when all products have sufficient stock
should include products with exactly zero stock
should not include products at exactly the threshold
should use default threshold when threshold is zero (falsy)
should handle very high threshold
should correctly track stock through restock followed by fulfill
should prevent overfulfillment after partial fulfillment
should handle complete product lifecycle from creation to deletion
should correctly identify low stock products after fulfillment
